text: Good morning everyone, question about Flumine: Say my bot crashes and I re-start it. On start up, is it possible to "poll" existing orders previously placed to avoid placing them again? I imagine this would somehow be prepopulating the blotter on start up? Any advice against doing this?

elements.text: Good morning everyone, question about Flumine: Say my bot crashes and I re-start it. On start up, is it possible to "poll" existing orders previously placed to avoid placing them again? I imagine this would somehow be prepopulating the blotter on start up? Any advice against doing this?

text: I repopulate off list_current_orders if the order doesnt come via the order stream (i think fully matched orders are not sent on initial sub)

elements.text: I repopulate off list_current_orders if the order doesnt come via the order stream (i think fully matched orders are not sent on initial sub)

text: Greath, thanks <@ULDAVFDRP>. I am now seeing that there is a worker that executes `poll_cleared_orders` maybe that is this functionality?

poll_cleared_orders
maybe that is this functionality?

text: 50-60% bucket is definitely performing badly, but the other ones look quite strong to me. But yeah, like I said, haven't done any market checks. I did spot check a few points where the favorite was the opposite of the market, which seems like a good sign. Of course, it's possible that it's right on average but isn't right on the ones when it disagrees with the market. Also it's possible those were just a few points I am looking at.

text: Sample size is 86... toy example, let's say you have 43 predictions where you're predicting 26% and the other 43 where you're predicting 100%. Your average prediction in this bucket is 63%. So the _calibration_ is good but the _accuracy_ is terrible

calibration
is good but the
accuracy
is terrible
